questions.question_text:
You create a network region Region1 in Microsoft Teams.

You are adding a network site to Region1. The site has a 1.5-Mb connection.

You need to ensure that all users at the site have a good voice experience.

What should you do?

choices.B: Assign the Region1 users a meeting policy that has a media bit rate of 1,500 Kbps.
choices.C: Create and assign a Teams Network Roaming Policy that has a media bit rate of 500 Kbs.
choices.D: Run the Microsoft 365 network connectivity test tool.
choices.A: Tag all traffic with a DSCP value of 46.

discussion.content: This question repeats several times with a different set of answers.. in all of them the answer has to do with network roaming policy. Why not in this one?

Selected Answer: D
Option B will allow only 1 successful meeting if all features are used.
Option C will allow only 3 concurrent calls to be successful.

Disabling video would be the right option for this low a bandwidth 1.5 mbps which is for whole site.

tagging all traffic with dscp 46 will do no differentiating to audio traffic, and dscp can't do anything about low bandwidth

if these are the only options, just run the network connectivity tool i would say

Option B will allow only 1 successful meeting if all features are used.
Option C will allow only 3 concurrent calls to be successful.

Disabling video would be the right option for this low a bandwidth 1.5 mbps which is for whole site.

comments.content: if these are the only options, just run the network connectivity tool i would say :p

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct - only voice traffic needs to be maintained. Tagging all traffic isn't targeting just voice traffic.

Selected Answer: A
Give answer is correct.:
DSCP (Differentiated Services Code Point) is a field in the IP header used for traffic differentiation and prioritization in networks. Assigning a DSCP value of 46 to all traffic is a way to provide a common level of service for specific types of traffic. This can help ensure that important traffic such as real-time voice or video gets priority over other traffic, improving their quality and reliability. It is important to note that the specific use of DSCP 46 and its impact on network behavior depends on the configuration of network devices and the agreed upon network policy.
From my point of view , the answer B is the correct one. Using a DSCP value doesn't warrant bandwith management.

Selected Answer: BC
Network sites allow you to apply bandwidth and QoS policies to specific physical locations. By defining them, you can implement roaming policies that dynamically control attributes such as IP video and bit rate, improving call quality based on location.

The assignment of usage locations in the Admin Center manages numbers and services in different regions, ensuring that Teams Phone policies and features are applied according to geographic location, maintaining regulatory compliance and optimizing resources.

Configuring country or region preferences on the SBC can influence media routing, but does not replace the need to define a network topology with network sites and usage locations to manage roaming bandwidth policies.

I think it should be B and D:
B. Create a network site.
D. Set Preferred country or region for media traffic for the Session Border Controller (SBC).
Explanation:
B. Creating a network site is necessary to group the locations and define the network bandwidth policies. Network sites are defined based on the physical location of the user or the device, and they are used to apply policies for media traffic, such as audio and video calls.

D. Setting the Preferred country or region for media traffic for the Session Border Controller (SBC) is necessary to ensure that media traffic is routed to the nearest SBC, based on the location of the user or the device. This reduces latency and provides better call quality.
and not A as : A. Adding the Teams client public IP addresses to the Trusted IPs list is not relevant to creating a network topology for roaming bandwidth policies. This action is used to bypass multi-factor authentication (MFA) and conditional access policies for Teams client connections from trusted IP addresses.
A and B as you can add Network Roaming Policy under Network Sites.

You are deploying Microsoft Teams Phone.
You have offices in the United States, the United Kingdom, Brazil, India, and China.
You will use Direct Routing for all the locations.
You need to create a network topology for roaming bandwidth policies.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.E: Implement dynamic emergency calling with Presence Information Data Format Location Object (PIDF-LO).
choices.A: Add the Teams client public IP addresses to the Trusted IPs list.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, assign a usage location.
choices.D: Set Preferred country or region for media traffic for the Session Border Controller (SBC).

Selected Answer: D
Tagging all traffic with a Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value of 46 is a common practice to prioritize voice traffic over other forms of traffic on a network. By tagging voice traffic with a DSCP value of 46, it is given priority in routing and ensures that it has adequate bandwidth and low latency to provide a good voice experience.

The other options are not directly related to improving the voice experience at a site with a 1.5 Mbps connection

Microsoft Teams will dynamically optimize for the best experience it can give based on the bandwidth available. You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: New-CsTenantNetworkSite -
Define network sites.
Use the New-CsTenantNetworkSite cmdlet to define network sites. Each network site must be associated with a network region.
New-CsTenantNetworkSite -NetworkSiteID <site ID> -NetworkRegionID <region ID>
Box 2: New-CsTenantNetworkSubnet

Define network subnets -
Use the New-CsTenantNetworkSubnet cmdlet to define network subnets and associate them to network sites. Each network subnet can only be associated with one site.
New-CsTenantNetworkSubnet -SubnetID <Subnet IP address> -MaskBits <Subnet bitmas
